summary: The Juilliard School in New York City is a top school for learning dance, drama, or music. It started as a music school in 1905 and later added other arts. The school is named after its big donor, Augustus Juilliard. Juilliard has a low acceptance rate and about 950 students. It offers different types of programs, from pre-college to graduate degrees. The school is at the Lincoln Center and has many performance spaces. Juilliard students and alumni have won lots of big awards, like Grammys, Tonys, Emmys, and Oscars.
title: Juilliard School
